description.value:
Trigger Nizca and Deg activate the shadow beacon

Effect The shadow beacon sparks to life. The trap then rolls initiative.

details.description: The shadow beacon's operation causes harmful energy to blast out of the base of the device.
details.disable:
@Check[crafting|dc:27] or @Check[thievery|dc:27] (master) to rig a dispersal system, or @Check[arcana|dc:27], @Check[nature|dc:27], @Check[occultism|dc:27], or @Check[religion|dc:27] (master) to safely vent the magical energy; four total successes in any combination to disable

Special Disabling the shadow discharge does not disable the shadow beacon.

publication.title: Pathfinder #215: To Blot Out the Sun

details.routine:
(1 action) The shadow beacon fires shadows into the sky, discharging excess energy out of the device's lower half. The trap deals @Damage[4d6[cold],4d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage to all non-shadow creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:60] from the base of the device (@Check[fortitude|dc:26|basic] save). For each successful check to disable the trap, the cold and void damage dealt by the trap on subsequent rounds are both reduced by 1d6 damage (see below). A creature that fails their save is pushed back 10 feet (15 feet on a critical failure).

@Damage[3d6[cold],3d6[void]|options:area-damage]

@Damage[2d6[cold],2d6[void]|options:area-damage]

@Damage[1d6[cold],1d6[void]|options:area-damage]
